org.phoenixbioinformatics.http

Class HttpHostFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.phoenixbioinformatics.http.HttpHostFactory

  • public class HttpHostFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory method class that builds an HTTP host from a servlet request and a set of options
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpHostFactory

        public HttpHostFactory(IPartnerPattern partnerPattern,
               IProperty property,
               java.lang.String scheme,
               java.lang.String serverName,
               int port,
               java.lang.String forwardedHost)
        Create a HttpHostFactory object.
        Parameters:
        partnerPattern - the partner-pattern interface for getting partner information
        scheme - the HTTP scheme
        serverName - the request server name ("host")
        port - the port accessed by the servlet request
        forwardedHost - the x-forwarded-for server name

    • Method Detail

      • getSourceHost

        public org.apache.http.HttpHost getSourceHost()
        Get the "source" host from the servlet request data. This is the scheme and authority originally directed at the proxy server. If the server has a proxy front end, the method takes into account whether that proxy changes the Host header or not (ProxyPreserveHost directive in Apache).
        Returns:
        an HTTP host object

      • getTargetHost

        public org.apache.http.HttpHost getTargetHost()
        Get the "target" host URI for the factory's source URI. If there is no partner corresponding to the source URI, the return will be null.
        Returns:
        a target HTTP host, or null if there is no partner for the source URI

      • getPartnerId

        public java.lang.String getPartnerId()
        Get the partner id of the partner identified by the source URI.
        Returns:
        a string partner id

      • getScheme

        java.lang.String getScheme()
        Get the scheme.
        Returns:
